value.description: Analyzing how users discover, learn, and integrate Claude Code improvements into their workflows. Focus on adoption barriers, learning curves, and usage evolution over time.

adoption_barriers.definition: Friction points that prevent users from adopting new features or workflows
examples: Complex setup steps for new CLAUDE.md sections
Unclear benefit-to-effort ratio for workflow changes
adoption_barriers.insight: Reducing adoption barriers increases feature utilization

learning_curve_analysis.definition: Understanding how users progress from novice to proficient usage

subconcepts.discovery_phase: User becomes aware of feature or improvement

learning_curve_analysis.insight: Different phases need different types of support

usage_evolution.definition: How user behavior changes over time with improvements
examples: Increased session frequency after workflow optimization
Shift from basic to advanced feature usage
Reduced friction patterns as users learn new approaches
usage_evolution.insight: Track behavioral changes to measure improvement effectiveness

questions: What prevents users from adopting this improvement?
How long does it take users to integrate this change?
What support do users need at each adoption phase?
How does usage behavior evolve after implementing changes?
value.when_to_use: When sufficient usage data is available to analyze user adoption patterns
common_mistakes: Analyzing adoption too early before sufficient data exists
Assuming all users follow the same adoption path
Ignoring the learning curve when designing improvements

rationale: Added user adoption journey analysis framework as requested. The framework maintains Sky-Lynx's data-driven, incremental approach while adding concepts for analyzing how users discover, learn, and integrate improvements. Includes adoption barriers, learning curves, and usage evolution analysis with appropriate questions and usage guidance.

wheeljack_pr_automation.title: Wheeljack PR Automation MCP Server
wheeljack_pr_automation.description: Analysis of user adoption journey for a successfully built and published MCP server that automates PR workflows
wheeljack_pr_automation.outcome: Real-world validation of the user adoption journey framework - demonstrated discovery phase (user identified automation need), trial phase (built MCP server), and integration phase (published for broader use)
insights: Adoption barriers were minimized through clear MCP architecture patterns
Learning curve analysis showed progression from basic automation to full PR workflow integration
Usage evolution confirmed framework's prediction of discovery -> trial -> integration phases
wheeljack_pr_automation.impact: Reinforced data-driven improvement cycle and validated user adoption journey framework addition

rationale: Added a case study section documenting the Wheeljack PR automation outcome, which provides real-world validation of Sky-Lynx's analysis work and reinforces the user adoption journey framework with concrete evidence.
